abstract: Wal-Mart is looking to expand its reach in China via a potential $1 billion deal to invest in one of the country’s biggest retail groups. The Telegraph reported Friday that Credit Suisse has been asked by Wal-Mart to draw up plans to buy part or all of Beijing Hualian, a hypermarket operator with stores in the capital and other cities across China.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart is looking to expand its reach in China via a potential $1 billion deal to invest in one of the country’s biggest retail groups. The Telegraph reported Friday that Credit Suisse has been asked by Wal-Mart to draw up plans to buy part or all of Beijing Hualian, a hypermarket operator with stores in the capital and other cities across China.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Could Spend $1 Billion on Chinese Retailer, Report Says

abstract: A bull market that left behind Bud and Wal-Mart
snippet: A bull market that left behind Bud and Wal-Mart
lead_paragraph: The double will have to wait.

headline.main: A Bull Market Without Beer and Cholesterol?
